explanation: An Aramaic word for 'father', used in a personal and intimate way.

Obeying all of God's commands and requirements.

People who are not Jewish.
The good news of God's reign or rule.

term: Great Apostle and High Priest of your confession
explanation: A title for Jesus Christ, emphasizing his role as both a messenger of God and the ultimate mediator between God and humanity.
A person or thing that announces or signals the approach of another; in this context, John the Baptist.
Composed of dissimilar ingredients; diverse.

Referring to the heavenly realm or the presence of God.

Lacking power or ability.

Relating to hell.

Lack of faith or belief in religion.

Unusually or disproportionately large; excessive.

Spiritual beings; angels or demons.
Impossible to refute or disprove; undeniable.
Impossible to remedy or correct.

Sharing an inheritance equally with others.
A symbolic representation of Jesus Christ, derived from the tribe of Judah in the Bible.
A king of Numidia in North Africa, known for his war against Rome.
Testimony given by an accomplice in a crime, used against other participants; also known as state's evidence.

A symbolic representation of Jesus Christ, referring to his sacrifice.
Joined in a conspiracy or alliance.

The promised deliverer of the Jewish people; Christians believe Jesus is the Messiah.

Exhibiting great diversity of elements; heterogeneous.
The site of Jesus' crucifixion.

explanation: To dedicate or consecrate a child to God's service.
Refuse; the dregs or waste matter; people considered worthless.

Made holy or consecrated; set apart for a sacred purpose.
A person who questions or doubts accepted opinions.
